skill.name: pylabrobot
skill.description: Vendor-agnostic lab automation framework. Use when controlling multiple equipment types (Hamilton, Tecan, Opentrons, plate readers, pumps) or needing unified programming across different vendors. Best for complex workflows, multi-vendor setups, simulation. For Opentrons-only protocols with official API, opentrons-integration may be simpler.
skill.summary: Vendor-agnostic lab automation framework. Use when controlling multiple equipment types (Hamilton, T...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill with no executable code. All 416 static findings are false positives triggered by Python code examples in markdown documentation. The skill is legitimate open-source laboratory automation software for controlling liquid handling robots and lab equipment.

content.value_statement: Automate laboratory workflows by controlling liquid handling robots, plate readers, and lab equipment through unified Python commands. This skill enables reproducible protocols across Hamilton, Tecan, and Opentrons platforms with built-in simulation for testing.
actual_capabilities: Control liquid handling robots (aspirate, dispense, transfer liquids)
Manage laboratory resources (plates, tips, troughs, custom labware)
Integrate plate readers for absorbance, luminescence, fluorescence measurements
Operate heater shakers, incubators, centrifuges, and pumps
Simulate protocols with ChatterboxBackend before running on hardware
Visualize deck layouts and track tip and liquid states in real-time
limitations: Requires pylabrobot package installation (uv pip install pylabrobot)
Physical hardware required for non-simulation operations
Opentrons-only workflows may be simpler with opentrons-integration skill
Multi-vendor setups require understanding of each platform's backend

use_cases.title: Automate Pipetting Tasks
use_cases.description: Program complex liquid transfer protocols for sample preparation, serial dilutions, and plate replication with automatic tip tracking.

use_cases.title: Multi-Vendor Integration
use_cases.description: Create unified protocols that work across Hamilton, Tecan, and Opentrons robots without rewriting code for each platform.

use_cases.title: Protocol Simulation
use_cases.description: Test and validate laboratory protocols in simulation mode before running expensive experiments on physical hardware.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Liquid Transfer
prompt_templates.scenario: Move liquid from one plate to another
prompt_templates.prompt: Use PyLabRobot to set up a liquid handler with a STAR backend and transfer 100 microliters from source plate well A1 to destination plate well A2.

prompt_templates.title: Deck Resource Setup
prompt_templates.scenario: Configure deck with plates and tips
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a deck layout in PyLabRobot with a tip rack at position 1, a source plate at position 5, and a destination plate at position 10.

prompt_templates.title: Plate Reader Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure a BMG CLARIOstar plate reader with PyLabRobot, set temperature to 37 degrees, and read absorbance at 450nm wavelength.

prompt_templates.title: Protocol Simulation
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a complete liquid handling protocol using ChatterboxBackend for simulation, then show how to visualize the deck state and verify the workflow.

output_examples.input: Set up a PyLabRobot liquid handler to aspirate 50 microliters from well A1 and dispense to well B1
output: Tip rack assigned to deck position 1
Aspirated 50 ÂµL from plate[A1] at 50 ÂµL/s flow rate

best_practices: Start with ChatterboxBackend simulation to validate protocols before running on expensive hardware
Enable tip tracking and volume tracking for accurate state management during experiments
Save deck layouts to JSON files for reproducibility across multiple protocol runs
anti_patterns: Running protocols on physical hardware without first testing in simulation mode
Not setting temperatures early when using heater shakers or incubators
Hardcoding resource positions instead of using descriptive names for better documentation

faq.question: What liquid handlers does PyLabRobot support?
faq.answer: PyLabRobot supports Hamilton STAR/STARlet, Opentrons OT-2, and Tecan EVO platforms through backend abstraction.

faq.question: Do I need physical hardware to test protocols?
faq.answer: No. Use ChatterboxBackend for simulation testing without hardware. The visualizer shows deck state in real-time.

faq.question: How does PyLabRobot compare to vendor APIs?
faq.answer: PyLabRobot provides a unified Python interface across vendors. Same code works on Hamilton, Tecan, and Opentrons.

faq.question: Can I save and load deck configurations?
faq.answer: Yes. Deck layouts and states can be serialized to JSON for reproducibility and sharing protocols.

faq.question: What plate readers are supported?
faq.answer: BMG CLARIOstar and CLARIOstar Plus are supported for absorbance, luminescence, and fluorescence measurements.

faq.question: Does this skill work on Windows and Mac?
faq.answer: Yes. PyLabRobot works on Windows, macOS, Linux, and Raspberry Pi for controlling laboratory equipment.
